body.p: To His Excellency Thomas. E. Bramlette Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your Petitioner James M Crawford States that at the February Term 1864 of the Rockcastle Circuit Court. He was fined $200.00 for Permitting Gaming upon his premsies, which offense was committed by Persons and not Notice by your petitioner owing to the confused state of the Country, caused by the Rebellion. Your petitioner states that he is a Loyal citizen, and a Poor man, and asks your Excellency to remit his fine, as in Duty bound he will ever Pray
We the undersigned citizens of Rockcastle county join in the Petition of James M Crawford and ask your Excellency to remit his fine

Charles A Redd
W. M. Fish C. R. C. C
M J. Cook
R. R. Hackney
W M. Saunders
Thos. M. Redd
F B McClary
James G Carter
R. Boyd Citizen of Laurel
Edwin Shivel
Wm McClure SRC
M. A. Brooks
Jas E Jones
E T Fish
D. G. Colyer
Sir I hope that you will remit the fine mentioned in the Petition

Rockcastle Ct Ct
vs
James M Crawford
Remit except fees & costs
Tho E Bramlette
26th Apl/64
$200-
